qas.question: What language has influenced the languages of India?
Of what is Hindi considered to be in relation to Sanskrit?
From what dialect is Hindi descended?
What is the percentage of Sanskrit words thought to be in modern Indo-Aryan languages?
What language texts  are as much as 70% Sanskrit?
What did the languages of India greatly influence?
What is the Khariboli dialect a Sanskritised register of?

plausible_answers.text: All modern Indo-Aryan languages, as well as Munda and Dravidian languages

qas.question: Where has Sanskrit borrowed words from?
What percent of vocabulary comes from languages of India?
What place are literary texts rarely considered lexically Sanskrit?

context: <a0_0><b5_0>Sanskrit<b5_0/><a0_0/> has greatly influenced the languages of India that grew from its vocabulary and grammatical base; for instance, <b6_0>Hindi<b6_0/> is a "<a1_0>Sanskritised register<a1_0/>" of the <a2_0>Khariboli<a2_0/> dialect. <b7_0>All modern Indo-Aryan languages, as well as Munda and Dravidian languages<b7_0/>, have borrowed many words either directly from Sanskrit (tatsama words), or indirectly via middle Indo-Aryan languages (tadbhava words). Words originating in Sanskrit are estimated at <b8_0>roughly <a3_0>fifty percent<b8_0/><a3_0/> of the vocabulary of modern Indo-Aryan languages, as well as the literary forms of Malayalam and Kannada. Literary texts in <a4_0><b9_0>Telugu<b9_0/><a4_0/> are lexically Sanskrit or Sanskritised to an enormous extent, perhaps seventy percent or more.
